content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="StreamNet_Tabs.xsl"?> <metadata>  <idinfo>   <citation>    <citeinfo>     <pubdate>20120622</pubdate>     <title>StreamNet - Potential Fish Passage Barriers (October, 2013)</title>     <geoform>vector digital data</geoform>     <othercit>Georeferenced via a combination of linear referencing to StreamNet's whole stream routed hydrography (MSHv3) and XY coordinates for features not readily located on a stream for relative scale or accuracy reasons.  See entity attribute section for details.</othercit>    </citeinfo>   </citation>   <descript>    <abstract>StreamNet's Potential Fish Passage Barrier dataset captures both natural and man-made in stream features that have the potential to block fish passage (culverts, dams, debris jams, cascades, falls, etc.). Where information exists, fish passage ability is captured. This dataset is maintained and updated on an annual or semi-annual basis. The OCTOBER, 2013 publication dataset includes 63,399 features across the states of Washington, Oregon, California and Idaho. Where possible, all barrier locations are georeferenced to StreamNet's regionally standardized routed hydrography layer (MSHv3.1) enabling comparison and analysis of barrier locations within the context of StreamNet's larger data holdings (fish counts, hatchery returns, redd counts, harvest records, generalized fish distribution, etc.,). These data are available for direct download as spatial data and may also be queried online using the StreamNet Data Query System.</abstract>    <purpose>This regionally-standardized dataset is a compilation of data contributed by StreamNet partner agencies as of OCTOBER, 2013.  It is intended to support the need for a region-wide, best-available representation of the potential fish passage barriers affecting fish migration throughout the states of Oregon, Washington, Idaho, western Montana and California.  The term 'potential' is used to highlight the fact that fish passage ability is coded as 'unknown' at a number of sites where a structure (eg., culvert)  has been identified but its ability to pass fish has not yet been determined.  Note: data users that are working on local projects solely within one of these states are advised to consult the particular state's source dataset as the state specific data may contain additional attributes of interest not available region-wide (see credits section for details). </purpose>   </descript>   <spdom>    <bounding>     <westbc>-125.541357</westbc>     <eastbc>-110.411554</eastbc>     <northbc>49.170714</northbc>     <southbc>32.370547</southbc>    </bounding>   </spdom>   <keywords>    <theme>     <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Categories</themekt>     <themekey>biota</themekey>     <themekey>environment</themekey>     <themekey>inlandWaters</themekey>     <themekey>structure</themekey>    </theme>    <theme>     <themekt>None</themekt>     <themekey>fish passage barriers</themekey>     <themekey>barriers</themekey>     <themekey>dams</themekey>     <themekey>culverts</themekey>     <themekey>tide gates</themekey>     <themekey>bridges</themekey>     <themekey>fords</themekey>     <themekey>water diversions</themekey>     <themekey>weirs</themekey>     <themekey>falls</themekey>     <themekey>cascades</themekey>     <themekey>fish passage</themekey>     <themekey>biota</themekey>     <themekey>environment</themekey>     <themekey>geoscientificInformation</themekey>     <themekey>inlandWaters</themekey>    </theme>   </keywords>   <accconst>None</accconst>   <useconst>None</useconst>   <datacred>StreamNet partner agencies that contributed to this dataset include: Washington Department of Fish and Wildlife (WDFW), Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife (ODFW), Idaho Department of Fish and Game (IDFG), Montana Fish Wildlife and Parks (MFWP), and California Department of Fish and Game (CDFG).  Feature level metadata identifies the source of each barrier record in the [CompiledBy] field.  See the Entity Attribute section of this metadata file for additional details.</datacred>   <native>Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.1.1.3143</native> <attrlabl>OBJECTID</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Internal feature number.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <udom>Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.</udom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Shape</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Feature geometry.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <udom>Coordinates defining the features.</udom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>BarrierID</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Unique identifier from StreamNet database.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>BarrierName</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Name of barrier, if applicable</attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>BarrierTypeID</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Code for the type of barrier - codes are dereferenced in the publication version of this dataset by the field [BarrierType]</attrdef>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>BarrierType</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Description of the type of barrier - decodes the [BarrierTypeID] field in the publication dataset.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>LocationID</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Linear Referencing attribute: Unique location code for the stream route the barrier is on.  In some cases, where the barrier is not referenced to a stream, it is a unique code for the point location as recorded in StreamNet relational database (Links to StreamNet's routed hydrogaphy and/or LocMaster table) </attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Name</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Stream / location name</attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>StreamAndTributary</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Qualified name that incudes reference to the watercourse downstream where applicable</attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>RiverMile</attrlabl>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>BegFt</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Linear referencing attribute:  Defines the beginning measure of the barrier location in feet.  Relates to StreamNet's regional whole-stream routed hydrography (MSHv3).  Carries a value of -1 if the LocationID does not represent a stream route (ie., XY point locations)</attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>EndFt</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Linear referencing attribute:  Defines the ending measure of the barrier location in feet.  Relates to StreamNet's regional whole-stream routed hydrography (MSHv3).  Carries a value of -1 if the LocationID does not represent a routed stream (ie., XY point locations)</attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Latitude</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Latitude coordinate of barrier in decimal degrees. Based on NAD83 datum.  Required if LocationID does not represent a routed stream. </attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Longitude</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Longitudecoordinate of barrier in decimal degrees. Based on NAD83 datum.  Required if LocationID does not represent a routed stream. </attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>LLsource</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Method by which the longitude and latitude values were determined. Required if LocationID does not represent a 100-k stream.</attrdef>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>BarrierOwner</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Identifies the owner of the barrier</attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>AgencyTypeID</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Code for the institutional status of the land owner (private, federal, state, etc.). Codes are dereferenced in the publication version of this dataset by the field [AgencyType]</attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>AgencyType</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Identifies the institutional status of the landowner (private, federal, state, etc.) - decodes the [AgencyTypeID] field in the publication dataset.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>StateFIPS</attrlabl>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>State</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Location Cross-Referencing:  State the barrier is located in - decodes the [StateCode] field in the publication dataset. </attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>CategoryID</attrlabl>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>DataCategory</attrlabl>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>FishWayTypeID</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Code for the type of fishway present to help fish pass the barrier. Note about regular round culverts: In this database, regular round culverts are not considered a type of fishway. Use code 201, 205, or 210 when appropriate. Use code 101 for unmitigated round culverts. Values are decoded by the [FishWayType] field in the publication dataset.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>FishWayType</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Describes the type of fishway present to help fish pass the barrier. Dereferences the [FishWayTypeID] field.  Note about regular round culverts: In this database, regular round culverts are not considered a type of fishway. </attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>FishWayTypeCat</attrlabl>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>FishWayStatusID</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Code for the presence of fish passage facilities. Code is dereferenced by the [FishWayStatus] field.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>FishWayStatus</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Describes the presence of fish passage facilities.  Decodes that [FishWayStatusID] field.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>FishWayStatCat</attrlabl>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>DamID</attrlabl>     <attrdef>The DamID code for BarrierTypeID = 1.  Uniquely identifies the DamID for Barriers that are also Dams in the StreamNet database. 98 = N/A  The descriptive name of the Dam is dereferenced by the [Dam_Name] field where applicable.  </attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Dam_Name</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Dam name where applicable - decodes that [DamID] field</attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>HatchID</attrlabl>     <attrdef>The HatcheryID code for BarrierTypeID = 5.  Uniquely identifies the HatchID for Barriers that are also Hatchery facilities in the StreamNet database. 98 = N/A  The descriptive name of the Hatchery facility is dereferenced by the [Hatchery_Name] field where applicable. </attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Hatch_Name</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Hatchery Name where applicable - decodes the [HatchID]field.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>RefID</attrlabl>     <attrdef>The primary reference number for the barrier in the StreamNet database - decoded by the [Citation] field</attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Citation</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Bibliographic Citation associated with the Barrier record - decodes the [RefID] field. </attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>CitationURL</attrlabl>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Year_Comp</attrlabl>     <attrdef>The year the barrier was completed.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Year_Removed</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Year the barrier was removed (if applicable)</attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>GenPassStatID</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Code identifying the General status of severity of the barrier in terms of whether this barrier blocks movement of all the fish in the stream.  Values are decoded by the [GeneralPassageStatus] field</attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>GeneralPassageStatus</attrlabl>     <attrdef>General status of severity of the barrier in terms of whether this barrier blocks movent of all the fish in the stream. Decodes that [GenPassStatID] field.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Height</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Height of barrier in feet. For a culvert, height is measured from the stream surface below the culvert to the surface of the water at the outlet of the culvert. This varies by season, so if possible [Comments] field should record when the measure was made (base flow; a month; a season; etc.).</attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Updated</attrlabl>     <attrdef>The date that the record was created or updated. For data obtained in electronic format from another source it can reflect the date and time of data capture or of conversion to StreamNet format.  This can be the time a record was created, the last time it was edited, or the last time it was QCd.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>InternalAgyNo</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Identifies a barrier in the database of the agency that provided the data to StreamNet -- i.e., the internal barrier identifier for WDFW, ODFW, CDFG, etc. This field ensures database updates are performed correctly, and lets data users communicate more clearly with the agencies providing the data. Use in combination with the [CompiledBy] field to identify the source agency. </attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>MapLabel</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Descriptive label identifying feature. Sometimes useful to set as the main display field for responding to clicks from the identify tool in applications</attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>CompiledBy</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Identifies StreamNet partner agency that compiled and submitted the barrier record.  Note that each partner agency collects data from numerous sources and separately tracks the lineage of data compiled.  The [InternalAgyNo] field is useful for relating to those additional details from the source agency.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>StreamNet</attrdefs>    </attr>   </detailed>  </eainfo>  <metainfo>   <metd>20131004</metd>   <metc>    <cntinfo>     <cntorgp>      <cntorg>StreamNet Project, Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commission</cntorg>      <cntper>Van C.
